methodologyNotes: Performed complete engine cooling system inspection and service following manufacturer specifications. All electrical components checked and thermostat replaced with new gasket.
technicalData:
Thermistor resistance: 2.4kΩ at 20°C
Coolant capacity: 5.5 litres
Cooling fan switch position: Engine bay - driver side
Recommended frost protection: -40°C
Thermostat gasket material: Cork composite
Thermostat opening temperature: 82°C
Torque wrench settings: Thermostat housing bolts 20Nm, Water pump bolts 25Nm
learnerProfile: Level 3 Motor Vehicle Service & Repair - Candidate 7290-702

tasks.description: Located and identified cooling system electrical/electronic components (thermostat sensor, cooling fan relay, temperature gauge sender)
Removed and tested coolant level - found to be 2 litres below minimum mark
Pressure tested cooling system - identified slow leak from thermostat housing area
Checked antifreeze/coolant protection level using refractometer - reading showed -20°C frost protection (below -40°C requirement)
Drained coolant from system using drain pan - collected approximately 3.2 litres
Removed thermostat housing cover using 13mm spanners - applied 20Nm torque setting
Extracted old thermostat and gasket - inspected for damage and corrosion
Fitted new thermostat (82°C opening temperature) with cork composite gasket
Refilled cooling system with correct coolant mixture and bled air from system
Performed pressure test on sealed cooling system - maintained 1.0 bar for 10 minutes
Inspected all hose connections and clamps - tightened clamps to secure hoses
Located source of leak - small crack in thermostat housing gasket seal (now replaced)
Tested coolant temperature sensor (thermistor) using multimeter - measured 2.4kΩ resistance at 20°C ambient
Checked cooling fan relay operation - fan engaged when temperature reached 95°C
Verified temperature gauge sender is functioning correctly - gauge reads accurately across temperature range
